head.title: Library System Offering Free Counseling Programs

hedline.hl1: Library System Offering Free Counseling Programs

abstract.p: WEBS, career and educational counseling service sponsored by Westchester County (NY) Library System, begins offering two free career-counseling and life-planning programs geared to those who are unemployed and workers over 50 seeking change (S)

block.p: Two free career-counseling and life-planning programs, offered by WEBS, a career and educational counseling service sponsored by the Westchester Library System, will be available in public libraries throughout the county this fall.

The Career Development Seminar, geared to those who are unemployed, re-entering the work force, changing careers or returning to school will be held at libraries in Ossining, Mount Kisco, White Plains and Yonkers.

Two free career-counseling and life-planning programs, offered by WEBS, a career and educational counseling service sponsored by the Westchester Library System, will be available in public libraries throughout the county this fall.

The Career Development Seminar, geared to those who are unemployed, re-entering the work force, changing careers or returning to school will be held at libraries in Ossining, Mount Kisco, White Plains and Yonkers.
''Take Charge! Life Planning After 50,'' a program to help adults plan for the next stage of life, will be offered at public libraries in New Rochelle, Mount Pleasant and Shrub Oak.
Information on dates, times and how to register is available by calling WEBS at (914) 674-3812.

IN BUSINESS Correction: August 13, 2000, Sunday A brief report last Sunday about career counseling and life planning programs offered by WEBS, a service of the Westchester Library System, misstated the information number. It is (914) 674-3612.
